sections.heading: Lead abatement training. The Advisory Council shall advise the Department whether a sufficient number of lead abatement training programs exist to serve the State
sections.text:
If the Department determines additional programs are needed, then the Department may
use funds appropriated under this Act to address the deficiencies.

sections.heading: Insurance assistance. The Department, through agreements with other public agencies, may
sections.text:
allow for reimbursement of certain insurance costs associated with
persons performing work under the Lead Direct Assistance Program.

sections.heading: Advisory Council. The Advisory Council shall assist the Department in developing an annual written report to the Governor and General Assembly on the operation and effectiveness of the CLEAR-WIN Program
